channel.title: WINDOWS CANOT FIND 'javaw'
channel.description:
Everytime i hit 'Run server' , a window keeps popping up saying " Windows cannot find ' javaw '. Make sure you typed the name correctly, and then try again.
I want to host my own server.Is there anyway to fix this Btw if you give any ideas, please help me STEP BY STEP.

item.title: WINDOWS CANOT FIND 'javaw'
item.dc:creator: @Criimzy Criimzy
item.description:
@Criimzy wrote:

What did i do wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: WINDOWS CANOT FIND 'javaw'
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“Criimzy, post:8, topic:332446”][quote author=Liquid Magic link=topic=428882.msg3148667#msg3148667 date=1268341833]

Where do i go to find what JDK version of java im using?

Click “My Computer”, then click “Program Files”, find the “Java” folder and open it, you SHOULD see something like “jdk1.6.0_18”, if it’s not there, try this:

Click “My Computer”, then click "Program Files (x86), then find the “Java” folder, you SHOULD see something like “jdk1.6.0_18”, if it’s not there, try this:

Download JDK.
[/quote]

My JDK version is jdk1.6.0_18 and i have already made the classpath and path.With my jdk version and when i click on run server.It still is popping up the message[/quote]

You did it wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: WINDOWS CANOT FIND 'javaw'
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

[quote=“Criimzy, post:4, topic:332446”]Yes im using Windows 7.
And can u tell me how i should set of my Enviromental Variables?[/quote]

Yeah, right click “My Computer” press properties, and click “Advanced Settings” unless you already see “Environmental Variables”

After you click advanced settings, click Environmental Variables, and at the top box press “New.”

Name it CLASSPATH with caps.

Copy and Paste this in the “New” part CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Rename the jdk1.6.0_18 to whatever your version of JDK is, next, do the same thing you just did, but name it PATH (with caps)

Copy and Paste this in there C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin

Change the JDK part again to whatever version you have, press “Ok” or “Apply” and try running whatever you need to now.

Read full topic
